title: Mercy! Cleveland Browns, Playoff Bullies, Dunk Steelers, Kansas City Awaits
sub_head: A playoff stranger makes up for lost time. Their next opponent should be a lot tougher
body:
It felt like a playoff game and an exorcism.
The Cleveland Browns scored 14 seconds into the contest—a fumble-recovery defensive touchdown on the first play, following a botched Pittsburgh snap. Then they scored again, five minutes later. Then they scored five minutes after that. Then another, less than three minutes later.
Thump, thump, thump, THUMP.
It was a cathartic, four-TD outburst for a franchise unaccustomed to consequential January football. Cleveland tallied an astonishing 28 points in the first quarter, going on to beat the Pittsburgh Steelers in the NFL Wild-Card round Sunday, 48-37, earning the city its first playoff victory since 1995.
“Am I really seeing this right now?” NBC’s Al Michaels asked in the first quarter.
